meanings.definition: Moving or positioned in an upright or vertical position.
meanings.sent1: The tree grew in an orthograde manner, reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: She stood orthograde, tall and proud.
meanings.sent3: The orthograde bookshelf looked like a tower of knowledge.
meanings.sent4: His orthograde determination propelled him to success.
meanings.sent5: The orthograde mountain stood majestically against the horizon.

meanings.definition: Having a straight or upright posture.
meanings.sent1: The soldier maintained an orthograde stance during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The orthograde giraffe gracefully walked across the savanna.
meanings.sent3: The orthograde scarecrow seemed to be guarding the field.
meanings.sent4: Her orthograde back indicated confidence and strength.
meanings.sent5: The orthograde palm tree swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Ascending or climbing in a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The orthograde vines climbed up the wall of the building.
meanings.sent2: The mountaineer tackled the orthograde cliff with determination.
meanings.sent3: The orthograde squirrel raced up the tree trunk in a straight line.
meanings.sent4: Her orthograde progress up the career ladder was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The orthograde staircase led to the top of the tower.
